intro: Callitriche autumnalis f. halleri, commonly known as the autumn water-star, is a flowering plant species belonging to the family Hydrocharitaceae. It is a submerged aquatic plant that typically grows in still or slow-moving freshwater environments. The plant features small, star-shaped flowers that are usually white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are ribbon-like and arranged in whorls around the stem. This variety is notable for its adaptability to various aquatic habitats and its role in aquatic ecosystems.
